tp.pr1

Class Street

  • java.lang.Object
    • tp.pr1.Street

  • public class Street
extends java.lang.Object
    A street links two places A and B. All streets are two-way streets. If a street is defined as Street(A,NORTH,B) this means that Place B is at NORTH of Place A and Place A is at south of Place B
    See Also:
    Place

    • Constructor Detail

      • Street

        public Street(Place source,
      Direction direction,
      Place target)
        Street Constructor.
        Parameters:
        source - Source place (in the example A).
        direction - Represents how is placed the target place with respect to the source place.
        target - Target place (in the example B).

    • Method Detail

      • comeOutFrom

        public boolean comeOutFrom(Place place,
                  Direction whichDirection)
        Checks if the street comes out from a place in a given direction. Remember that streets are two-way
        Parameters:
        place - The place to check
        whichDirection - Direction used.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the street comes out from the input Place.

      • nextPlace

        public Place nextPlace(Place whereAmI)
        Returns the place of the other side from the place whereAmI.
        Parameters:
        whereAmI - The place where I am.
        Returns:
        It returns the Place at the other side of the street. Returns null if whereAmI does not belong to the street.
